main event: On 18 April 1948 at 1306 local time, a 1st Lt. stationed at Ladd Air Force Base reported sighting a flying disc over the city of Fairbanks, Alaska. The object was described as round and flat, approximately 8 inches in diameter, with a silvery color and oscillating at a rapid rate from horizontal to vertical planes. No sound or exhaust trails were noted, and it disappeared after a few minutes.
interesting points: The sighting took place in broad daylight, with clear weather and unrestricted visibility.
The object was estimated to be traveling at a speed of 250-300 miles per hour, covering approximately 500 feet in 3 seconds.
It was suggested that the reflection of sunlight from the wings of aircraft in the local area may have caused the sighting.
The document did not include any photographs of the reported object.
No photographs were available, and no sketches of the object were provided in the report.
sighted object: round and flat, silvery-colored flying disc
witnesses: 1st Lt. stationed at Ladd Air Force Base
